segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
16. Saddhammavagga
159. Udāyīsutta
Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivutaṃ dhammaṃ desentaṃ nisinnaṃ.
Disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desetī”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”

segments.pli: “Na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ.
segments.en: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.

segments.pli: Paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
segments.en: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
‘Anupubbiṃ kathaṃ kathessāmī’ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo;
segments.en: You should teach Dhamma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ …

segments.pli: ‘pariyāyadassāvī kathaṃ kathessāmī’ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo;
‘anuddayataṃ paṭicca kathaṃ kathessāmī’ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo;
‘na āmisantaro kathaṃ kathessāmī’ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo;
segments.en: ‘I will not teach while secretly hoping to profit.’ …

segments.pli: ‘attānañca parañca anupahacca kathaṃ kathessāmī’ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
segments.en: ‘I will teach without hurting myself or others.’

segments.pli: Na kho, ānanda, sukaraṃ paresaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ.
segments.en: It’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.

segments.pli: Paresaṃ, ānanda, dhammaṃ desentena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo”ti.
segments.en: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
